channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WA

item.title: Report X-2023120706
item.description:
Report X-2023120706

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-19T18:11:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-12
  • City: TACOMA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: As the package was being unloaded the package handler noticed the bottom of the box was wet. DescribePack: Loose/ Vented caps DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Once the package was discovered the box was placed in a hazmat tote, taken to the damaged hazmat cage, and set under the vent.

item.title: Report X-2023120462
item.description:
Report X-2023120462

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-06
  • City: PASCO
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: At 5:45am i was called to the unload and when i reached the scene, I discovered a hazmat that i thought was at first just wet from the weather but upon further inspection i discovered that it was leaking due to loose lids and/or mishandling from Origin station. There was also two packages that got leaked on as i looked into the trailer. Tracking numbers-712973464726-712973464862 I then cleared the area and got lined hazmat totes and put the hazmat in said tote and affected packages as well. DescribePack: Loose caps DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Put into lined hazmat tote and used soak pads to clean up any material spilt.

item.title: Report X-2023120265
item.description:
Report X-2023120265

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-19T18:11:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-28
  • City: AUBURN
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was removed from the package flow due to leaking paint. Then it was quickly placed inside line tote and brought to QA for inspection. Upon inspection package contains 2 - one-gallon cans of Utech Intermix Tint U100 White which proved to be hazardous. No hazmat labeling was found on the box. DescribePack: One can has a loose lid and its completely covered in paint and leaking. A second can of paint does not seem to have leaked however it is covered in paint. Both of the cans were dented and have no clips. There was no inner packing material inside the box to protect them from denting. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately placed inside a lined tote to contain the leaking paint.

item.title: Report X-2023120190
item.description:
Report X-2023120190

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-28
  • City: AUBURN
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered wet and leaking. It was immediately removed from the van and placed inside a line tote. Upon inspection, package contains two 3.75 L cans of AutoBase plus MM Q065 connecto which proved to be hazardous. DescribePack: One can of Autobase has a loose lid which allowed its content to spill out. The can looks dented with missing clips. The second can is covered in the material that spilled out from the other can. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately placed inside a lined bin to mitigate the effects of the release.

item.title: Report X-2023120201
item.description:
Report X-2023120201

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-13T18:12:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-13
  • City: SPOKANE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Odorous sticky package found in trailer. Package brought to QA for inspection. Upon inspection, internal LQ marking found. SDS Researched. Package identified as an LQ and staged in hazmat cage. DescribePack: Internal cans were crushed causing the lids of cans to fail and leak product through internal box and external box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon discovery of hazard, package was placed inside hazmat tote using proper PPE. Hazmat tote placed in well ventilated hazmat cage and under fume hood.

item.title: Report X-2023080992
item.description:
Report X-2023080992

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-16T00:32:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-03
  • City: SEATTLE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The shipment was discovered during sort operations. The box has indications on the outside that it contains a MODEL#S2 MAX ELECTRIC SCOOTER HIBOY, 48vDC, 11.5 Ah, Max Speed: 19mph, Max Load: 220 lbs. Mfg: Freeman IT Limited. The scooter is USED and was being returned by the shipper with an RMA. The shipment is being held for FAA investigation.
